intro: Solanum artense, commonly known as the artense nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, oval berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and research settings.
